intro: Paraboea lavandulodora, commonly known as the lavender scented vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, lavender-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. It typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its foliage is usually dark green and glossy, contributing to its visual appeal in both natural and cultivated settings.
